podcasts.title: Reply All
podcasts.description: Reply All is a show about the internet and trained rats, time travel, celebrity dogs, lovelorn phone scammers, angry flower children, workplace iguanas, and more.

podcasts.title: Planet Money
podcasts.description: The economy, explained, with stories and surprises. Imagine you could call up a friend and say, 'Meet me at the bar and tell me what's going on with the economy.' Now imagine that's actually a fun evening. That's what we're going for at Planet Money.

podcasts.title: This American Life
podcasts.description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Most weeks, it is the most popular podcast in the country, with around 2.5 million people downloading each episode.

podcasts.title: Criminal
podcasts.description: Criminal is a podcast about crime. Stories of people who've done wrong, been wronged, or gotten caught somewhere in the middle.

podcasts.title: How I Built This
podcasts.description: How I Built This is a podcast about innovators, entrepreneurs, and idealists, and the stories behind the movements they built.

podcasts.title: Radiolab
podcasts.description: Radiolab is a show about curiosity. Where sound illuminates ideas, and the boundaries blur between science, philosophy, and human experience.

podcasts.title: Start Up
podcasts.description: StartUp is a podcast about what it’s really like to get a business off the ground.

podcasts.title: 99% Invisible
podcasts.description: 99% Invisible is about all the thought that goes into the things we don’t think about — the unnoticed architecture and design that shape our world.

podcasts.title: Lore
podcasts.description: Our fears have roots. Lore exposes the darker side of history, exploring the creatures, people, and places of our wildest nightmares.

podcasts.title: Hidden Brain
podcasts.description: Using science and storytelling, Hidden Brain reveals the unconscious patterns that drive human behavior, the biases that shape our choices, and the triggers that direct the course of our relationships.

podcasts.title: Invisibilia
podcasts.description: Invisibilia (Latin for invisible things) is about the invisible forces that control human behavior – ideas, beliefs, assumptions and emotions.
podcasts.host: Lulu Miller, Hanna Rosin and Alix Spiegel

podcasts.title: Download This Show
podcasts.description: Explore the latest in technology, social media, consumer electronics, digital culture and more. Each week host Marc Fennell and his panel of lively, informed guests untangle your wired world on Download this Show.

podcasts.title: Ted Radio Hour
podcasts.description: A journey through fascinating ideas: astonishing inventions, fresh approaches to old problems, new ways to think and create.

podcasts.title: Trace
podcasts.description: Explore the latest in technology, social media, consumer electronics, digital culture and more. Each week host Marc Fennell and his panel of lively, informed guests untangle your wired world on Download this Show.

podcasts.title: StoryCorps
podcasts.description: A weekly podcast whose mission is to preserve and share humanity’s stories in order to build connections between people and create a more just and compassionate world.
